messages.content: So iff the prussik or the munter mule failed the pully on the locker would catch them. In the method I explained if the munter muled failed the whole rope team would be shock loaded into the crevasse
In this method the whole rope team is still hooked up through the masterpoint

Well I was thinking something like... Explaining this as best as possible over text... The micro traction on a 8 on a bite one one end. On the other just a stopper knot like in the photo. And in the middle munter muled through the masterpoint. But then with this method the entire rope team is only hooked up to the anchor through a single munter mule(probably made from cordelette )
If you have a gri gri or a guide act you could use that as well
Yah. So would you just use a dyneema sling or something in between?

Well there was no munter mule at all in our class. I think having a way to lower somebody who gets crushed against the lip is one more layer of complexity and something that could easily be fucked up that wasn't nessisary on an entry level glacier travel  course
Oh interesting. So the guide who showed you was wrong?
We are not using prussiks to capture the progress. Instead substitute a micro traction

If the fallen climber gets pulled into the lip of the crevasse by your pully system you could actually crush him against the lip and kill him potentially (easily with a 5-1 pully system ) . With the micro traction there is no way to disengage the teeth and lower the fallen climber so you need to have the entire micro traction on a munter mule
Now where you do use the munter mule is off the masterpoint
First of all if one person is holding the fall you just build 2 anchors equalize and then clip the fallen climber on once both anchors are complete. The munter mule method we used was incorrect.
Just to correct some mistakes we made during our crevasse rescue training.
Wifi is sucking fat dick right now

I guess 2 will be alright. Also I think since we will have a whole day tomorrow it would be cool to practice rappelling off a bollard which we can back up with another snow anchor. If there is anything else you guys want to try let us know

How important?
I don't own a saw...
It

Also if you have a big strong Ikea style shopping bag or duffel(or any really strong bag) than we can fill with snow and throw over the edge of the cliff to simulate the weight of a fallen climber bring ir
I have my snow saw

VERY IMPORTANT

bring a saw. A wood saw would work fine
Just having flashbacks of biking 40 lbs of pickles and olives up the hill to oberammergau on a bike.
It's all coming together now
Ahhhhhh
No I was saying I'm going to buy you some gross ass dehydrated meal
Even though they make no sense for the backcountry.
Just goofing because andre obsessed with them
Oh I thought that was andre asking me to but pickles
It's too late anyway, we already bought the economy size jug
That was what you asked for, isn't it?
Wait why the fuck am I getting pickles
Yea sounds good

Sounds good to me.
You'll get dinners for us and we're each responsible for the rest of our own meals?
Sorry 1800
Sunset is at 1900
I can get the food now. I though I worked a day shift

So loose plan.... Marc tours up in the morning, Toby and I meet you at the Bergwacht HÃ¼tte at like 1300 or something, build and igloo on night one, do crevasse rescue training during the day on Monday, Toby skis down and Marc and I build a snow cave for night #2?
Meals at decathlon are out of stock except for two breakfast types
No im thinking we can find a spot in nomans land to do it maybe down over the cliff into last chance etc
Are you thinking go to Ziggy  on Monday for crevasse stuff?
Also I got some shit I should do on monday so I am thinking only Sunday night
Liberate yourself
Sorry I'm not a slave to technology Andre
Toby is notoriously shit at responding to messages so just get that pickel, peanut butter, shrimp and garlic mix they have

My blablacar ride isn't going to happen today so I'll take the train down tomorrow morning.

I'm off to get some dehydrated meals - 6 dinners? Any requests / restrictions besides dairy for Andre?
I don't but I have a liquid gas stove and I think I have a bunch fuel

Also, I'm not sure how much gas we'll burn through melting snow. My can isn't new and if this snow melt takes a ton of fuel, we might need more. Does anyone have one of these they could throw in their bag just in case.

So we need more food in that case -
dinner
breakfast
lunch
dinner
breakfast?
Sunday then monday
Sorry I don't know the days of the week
Id also be interested in spending 2 nights up there. Maybe Sunday build and igloo. Saturday do some crevasse rescue and maybe avalanche training and then build a snow cave that same day
I feel like I've seen them on the economy, if we want to go that route I can check
We also need instant mash potatoes which I've only ever seen at the commissary.

Igloo or cave works for me, decide based on snow conditions up there?
There's always ramen bombs? Alternatively, if this blablacar ride falls through (quite likely) then I could go to Decathlon here and get some meals today.

I'm bringing a 1 liter pot and a little pocket rocket type stove and gas. I guess if we did Ramen bombs we'd need more eating containers so maybe dehydrated stuff would be easier.

And as far as food goes do someone have time to stop by Conrad's and pick up a couple dehydrated meals. I'm busy with work and shit all day so I have no time. I'm assuming we will want to do dehydrated meals after building the shelter because everything else will take too long?
Everyone should do some research on snow caves or do we want to do an igloo?
Just for logistics for tomorrow I'm going to work late tonight so I'll probably get on the mountain later giving Marc time to tour up. I've read snow caves take 3 hours to build
AndrÃ© created the group.
